remarks: A linear-combination sum is finitely supported if the coefficients are.  (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 28-Feb-2015.)  Obsolete version of ~ lcomfsupp as of 15-Jul-2019.  (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
statement:
lcomf.f $e |- F = ( Scalar ` W ) $.
lcomf.k $e |- K = ( Base ` F ) $.
lcomf.s $e |- .x. = ( .s ` W ) $.
lcomf.b $e |- B = ( Base ` W ) $.
lcomf.w $e |- ( ph -> W e. LMod ) $.
lcomf.g $e |- ( ph -> G : I --> K ) $.
lcomf.h $e |- ( ph -> H : I --> B ) $.
lcomf.i $e |- ( ph -> I e. V ) $.
lcomfsupp.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` W ) $.
lcomfsupp.y $e |- Y = ( 0g ` F ) $.
lcomfsupOLD.j $e |- ( ph -> ( `' G " ( _V \ { Y } ) ) e. Fin ) $.
lcomfsupOLD $p |- ( ph -> ( `' ( G oF .x. H ) " ( _V \ { .0. } ) ) e. Fin ) $.
